Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The pro-Russian hacktivist group NoName057(16) claims responsibility for multiple DDoS attacks against the websites of at least five banks, including Intesa Sanpaolo, the largest bank in Italy, and the websites of an Italian water supply company, a national business newspaper, and a public transport website.

Date Occurred: February 7, March 11, May 19-21, May 27-28, and June 18-21
Description: American apparel retailer Hot Topic notifies customers about multiple cyberattacks between February 7 and June 21 that resulted in exposing sensitive information to hackers.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) discloses that state hackers have been exploiting two flaws in Ivanti's Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM), formerly MobileIron Core, since April.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Cofense warn of increased phishing activity that abuses Google Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) to bypass email security measures and get to inboxes of enterprise employees.

Author: Vietnamese threat actors
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks uncover a previously unreported phishing campaign that uses new variants of the NodeStealer malware to compromise Facebook corporate accounts.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Serco Inc, the Americas division of multinational outsourcing company Serco Group, discloses a data breach after attackers stole the personal information of over 10,000 individuals from a third-party vendor's MoveIT managed file transfer (MFT) server.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Lumico Life Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that a MOVEit data breach at Pension Benefits Information.

The National Science Foundation’s National Optical-Infrared Astronomy Research Laboratory (NOIRLab) detects a cyber incident in its computer systems, forcing the suspension of astronomical observations at Gemini North in Hawai‘i.
Researchers from Guardz reveal that a new Hidden Virtual Network Computing (hVNC) malware targeting macOS devices is being advertised on a prominent cybercrime forum.

Author: Killnet
Description: The pro-Russian group Killnet along with other hacker groups claims to have targeted the London Metal Exchange (LME) with a cyber attack. The London Metal Exchange cyber attack has not been confirmed by the organization.
The North American Better Business Bureau has been warning consumers that scammers are exploiting QR code payment methods in parking lots across the US.
Hospitality Staffing Solutions (HSS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed the company’s computer network.
Thousands of health-care workers’ personal information is compromised in a data breach that’s targeted three websites on servers at the Health Employers Association of BC.
Discovery at Home issues a website notice about a phishing incident they discovered on June 1.
LeetSwap halts transactions, after an attacker exploits a smart contract function to inflate the price of $630,000 worth of ETH tokens on the platform before draining them

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and, FIN11
Description: Performance Health Technology (PH Tech), a company that provides data management services to U.S. healthcare insurers, confirms in a notice that it was impacted by the MOVEit mass-hacks

Target: Valuable Facebook accounts of Multiple Organizations
Description: Researchers from Guardio Labs reveal that attackers exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Salesforce's email services and SMTP servers dubbed 'PhishForce', to launch a sophisticated phishing campaign targeting valuable Facebook accounts.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from the Shadow Server Foundation reveal that hundreds of Citrix Netscaler ADC and Gateway servers have already been breached and backdoored in a series of attacks targeting the critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability tracked as CVE-2023-3519.

Author: APT29 (AKA Cozy Bear, Cloaked Ursa, BlueBravo, Midnight Blizzard, and formerly Nobelium)
Target: Fewer than 40 Government, non-government organizations (NGOs), IT services, technology, discrete manufacturing, and media sectors organizations
Description: Microsoft reveals that the hacking group tracked as APT29 and linked to Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) targeted dozens of organizations worldwide, including government agencies, in Microsoft Teams phishing attacks.
A site impersonating Flipper Devices promises a free Flipper Zero after completing an offer but only leads to shady browser extensions and scam sites.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The West Oaks School is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.

Author: BlueCharlie AKA Callisto/Calisto, COLDRIVER, Star Blizzard/SEABORGIUM, TAG53
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future  discover a new infrastructure attributed with associated with the threat activity group BlueCharlie to launch attacks against a variety of targets.

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: Over 50 different government, finance, telecom, travel, public transport and news organizations across Spain
Description: The Russian collective NoName057(16) launches a total of 85 DDoS attacks targeting over 50 different government, finance, telecom, travel, public transport and news organizations across Spain.

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware group adds U.S.-based software company Parathon to its victim list. The hackers claimed to have 560 GB of data of employee data and other information, exfiltrated after the Parathon cyber attack.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for a cyber attack on the website of a Nigerian mobile telecommunication company, MTN,
Researchers from Sophos discover a new CryptoRom scam campaign using generative AI to assist in the interaction with victims.

Researchers from Kasada discover a new malware campaign making use of malicious OpenBullet configuration files to target inexperienced cyber criminals with the goal of delivering a remote access trojan (RAT) capable of stealing sensitive information.

EP Global Production Solutions (Entertainment Partners) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access and acquire files from the company’s computer network.
The Nigerian National Information Technology Development Agency (NIDTA) warns about DDoS attacks of hacktivists targeting important digital infrastructure in the country.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Rilide
Description: Researchers from Trustwave discover a new version of the Rilide Stealer extension targeting Chromium-based browsers such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Brave, and Opera.

Author: Lazarus Group
Description: Researchers from ReversingLabs and Sonatype discover a malicious package that mimics the VMware vSphere connector module ‘vConnector’, uploaded on the Python Package Index (PyPI) under the name ‘VMConnect,’ targeting IT professionals.

Researchers from Guidepoint reveal that attackers are increasingly abusing the legitimate Cloudflare Tunnels feature to create stealthy HTTPS connections from compromised devices, bypass firewalls, and maintain long-term persistence.
According to a senior official, ransomware attacks targeting Finnish organizations have increased four-fold since the Nordic country began the process of joining NATO.

Author: Mysterious Team Bangladesh
Target: Government, financial, and transportation industries primarily in India and Israel
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal that the hacktivist group Mysterious Team Bangladesh has launched more than 750 DDoS attacks since June 2022, primarily against Government, financial, and transportation industries in India and Israel.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware group adds Best Motel to the list of their victims.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware group adds Federal Electric Corp (FEC) to the list of their victims.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware group adds Construction CRD to the list of their victims.

Author: STRRAT
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a new campaign distributing a new version 1.6 of the STRRAT malware with a new infection technique.
Researchers from AhnLab reveal that Linux systems in South Korea are under attack by threat actors utilizing an open-source rootkit named Reptile.

Target: Developers involved in the cryptocurrency sphere
Description: Researchers from Phylum discover a stealthy malware on npm, the popular package manager for JavaScript, posing a severe threat by exposing sensitive developer data.
Omaha Health Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that an incident at a third-party vendor compromised consumers enrolled in the Medicare Part D Prescription Drug Plan.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and, FIN11
Description: Unum Group’s subsidiary Starmount Life Insurance Company posts a notice of data breach on its website after discovering that the company’s MOVEit server was accessed by an unauthorized party.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The FBI warns of fraudsters posing as Non-Fungible Token (NFT) developers to prey upon NFT enthusiasts and steal their cryptocurrency and NFT assets.
The Colorado Department of Higher Education (CDHE) discloses a massive data breach impacting students, past students, and teachers after suffering a ransomware attack in June.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from McAfee reveal that the Google Play store was infiltrated by 43 Android applications with 2.5 million installs that secretly displayed advertisements while a phone's screen was off, running down a device's battery.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The U.S. Health Sector Cybersecurity Coordination Center (H3C) warns about a wave of Rhysida ransomware attacks targeting healthcare organizations in the U.S.

Author: Rhysida
Description: Prospect Medical Holdings, a major hospital network with arms in multiple states, dealing with widespread network outages due to a cyberattack, which the FBI confirmed to be ransomware.

Author: NDT SEC
Description: The NDT SEC group claims responsibility for an attack to Delta Electronics in Thailand.

Author: Team R70
Description: In name of OpIndia, Team R70 claims responsibility for defacing the website of the Chhattisgarh State Biodiversity Board.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Israel’s National Cybersecurity Directorate declares there was “no breach” of its network after passwords belonging to a senior agency official were stolen from their home computer earlier this year and published online.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from McAfee discover a new adware campaign specifically targeting Korean Android users.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Radius Global Solutions files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s MOVEit server.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Indiana University Health (IU Health) posts a notice on its website announcing a data breach that occurred as a result of a third-party vendor’s (TMG Health) use of the file transfer program MOVEit.
Loren D. Stark Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was the target of a recent cyberattack.
Capital Neurological Surgeons discloses that an unauthorized individual gained access to an employee email account and potentially obtained patient information.

Author: Lone Wolf
Description: Researchers from Bi.Zone reveal that the Lone Wolf ransomware group launches multiple campaigns against organizations In Russia in the logistics, manufacturing, and financial sectors.
The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) warns of a wave of attacks targeting state organizations using 'Merlin,' an open-source post-exploitation and command and control framework.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: K & L Gates is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Delaware Life is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Zurich Brazil is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: IBL Healthcare is listed as a new victim by the ALPHV ransomware group on their dark web portal.

Author: 8BASE
Description: The 8BASE ransomware group has disclosed information regarding a cyberattack targeting the website of Delaney Browne Recruitment, an England-based recruitment agency.

Author: ScarCruft
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One reveal that the North Korean threat group ScarCruft hacked the IT infrastructure and email server for NPO Mashinostroyeniya, a Russian space rocket designer and intercontinental ballistic missile engineering organization using a Windows backdoor named 'OpenCarrot'.

Author: Yashma (Vietnamese threat actors)
Target: Organizations in China, Vietnam, Bulgaria and several other English-speaking countries.
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover an unknown threat actor, seemingly of Vietnamese origin, conducting a ransomware operation targeting organizations in China, Vietnam, Bulgaria and several other English-speaking countries.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang adds to its leak site Varian Medical Systems, a radiation oncology treatments and software maker acquired by Siemens Healthineers two years ago.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Aristocrat confirms to have been hit by the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Bank OZK files a notice of data breach after discovering that one of the company’s business partners experienced a data breach related to a vulnerability in MOVEit.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: Hartford Life and Accident Insurance Company (The Hartford)
Description: Hartford Life and Accident Insurance Company (The Hartford) files a notice of data breach explaining that a cyber incident resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information, including their names and Social Security numbers. The breach is probably related to the exploitation of the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Vecino Health Centers announces it was affected by the recent MOVEit cyber attack

Author: ThreatSec
Description: The ThreatSec group allegedly claims to have hacked into MindX Technology School (mindx.edu.vn), database and is kept for sale
Researchers from Imperva discover a massive phishing campaign involving 800 different scam domains and impersonated around 340 legitimate companies all over the world.
The Health Service of Madeira (SESARAM) confirms a cyber attack and suspends non-urgent activity.

Author: Chinese cyberespionage group
Description: Classified military networks run by Japan reportedly suffered a massive breach in 2020 at the hands of a Chinese cyberespionage group. Attackers accessed Ministry of Defense plans as well as information about military capabilities and shortcomings.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Mallox (AKA TargetCompany, Fargo, and Tohnichi)
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Mallox ransomware group is stepping up in a new campaign of targeted attacks against organizations with vulnerable SQL servers.

Target: IVF Michigan and Ohio Fertility Centers
Description: IVF Michigan and Ohio Fertility Centers notifies 9,383 patients that some of their protected health information was compromised in a February 25, 2023, ransomware attack.

The UK Electoral Commission discloses a massive data breach exposing the personal information of anyone who registered to vote in the United Kingdom between 2014 and 2022 after suffering a cyber attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Sandworm
Description: Ukrainian security services say they prevented an attempt by Russian state-controlled hackers from the Sandworm group to break into the battlefield management system used by the Ukrainian military.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Microsoft provides security updates for 87 flaws, including CVE-2023-36884 and CVE-2023-38180, two actively exploited and twenty-three remote code execution vulnerabilities.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Missouri's Department of Social Services (DSS) warns that protected Medicaid healthcare information was exposed in a data breach after IBM suffered a MOVEit data theft attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Global Atlantic Financial Group files a notice of data breach after discovering the MOVEit-related data breach at Pension Benefit Information.

Author: RedHotel, AKA TAG-22, Charcoal Typhoon and BRONZE UNIVERSITY
Target: Organizations across at least 17 countries across Asia, Europe and North America
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future reveal that the RedHotel group, affiliated with China’s Ministry of State Security targeted a range of government, telecommunications and research organizations across at least 17 countries since 2021.
The Israeli hospital Mayanei Hayeshua Medical Center, near Tel Aviv, is hit with a ransomware attack, prompting it to stop admitting new patients and redirecting people to nearby hospitals.

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: Government and public services websites in France
Description: The pro-Russia collective NoName057(16) claims responsibility for cyberattacks on government and public services websites in France. The list of the targets include the country’s customs service (Direction générale des douanes et droits indirects) and the French financial regulator.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: Government and public services websites in the Netherlands
Description: The pro-Russia collective NoName057(16) claims responsibility for cyberattacks on government and public services websites in the Netherlands. The list of the target includes: Dutch public transport website, local bank SNS, the Groningen seaport, and the website of the municipality of Vlardingen.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: K0LzSec
Target: Bank of Ayudhya, also known as Krungsri
Description: The fifth-largest bank in Thailand, the Bank of Ayudhya, also known as Krungsri is allegedly hacked by K0LzSec group.

Author: UserSec
Description: The UserSec collective takes responsibility for taking down the website of the Birmingham Airport.

Author: UserSec
Description: The UserSec collective takes responsibility for taking down the website of the Belfast Airport.

Author: Agniane stealer
Description: A new information stealer, dubbed Agniane stealer, emerges on the dark web. promoted in the hacking community.

Author: Qilin
Description: The Qilin ransomware adds Thonburi Energy Storage Systems (TESM) to its victim list.

Researchers from Cyble discover a new tech scam campaign, involving scammers setting up a non-existent antivirus solution site to deceive users into paying for non-existent services, and leveraging various ransomware variants to propagate the fraudulent schemes.

Author: Lchaia/xmrig
Description: Researchers from Aqua Security reveal the details of the Lchaia/xmrig campaign, exploiting misconfigured Kubernetes clusters for cyrptomining.

Author: ssww
Description: Researchers from Aqua Security reveal the details of the ssww campaign, exploiting misconfigured Kubernetes clusters for cyrptomining.

Author: Statc Stealer
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a new information stealer malware, called Statc Stealer, that can steal a broad range of info from Windows devices.

Author: Karakurt
Description: Jefferson County Health Center reveals that unauthorized individuals gained access to its network between April 04, 2023, and May 30, 2023, and may have obtained files containing patients’ protected health information. The Karakurt ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: 8base
Description: Oregon Sports Medicine is added to the 8Base ransomware leake site.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The NoEscape ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Kreacta, a consulting company in Italy
Researchers from Proofpoint discover a campaign using 120,000 phishing emails sent to over a hundred organizations to steal Microsoft 365 accounts via the EvilProxy phishing-as-a-service platform.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Rhysida ransomware operation lists an undisclosed healthcare organization in Australia in their website.

Author: Chinese Threat Actors
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) discloses the discovery of a backdoor malware named 'Whirlpool' used in attacks on compromised Barracuda Email Security Gateway (ESG) devices.

Author: Gafgyt
Description: Researchers from Fortinet issue an alert warning that the Gafgyt botnet malware is actively trying to exploit CVE-2017-18368, a vulnerability in the end-of-life Zyxel P660HN-T1A router in thousands of daily attacks.

Author: Agent Tesla
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a new campaign using “Tax-related documents and accompanying control panel files (CPL)” to deliver the Agent Tesla malware.

Author: Xurum
Description: Researchers from Akamai discover Xurum, a campaign targeting ecommerce stores using Adobe's open source Magento 2, exploiting CVE-2022-24086, a critical vulnerability that was patched on 2022.

Target: Organizations in Europe and North America
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new campaign using the Rust-based injector Freeze[.]rs to introduce a combination of XWorm and Remcos.

Target: Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services
Description: The Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential information in its possession was subject to unauthorized access.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: EMS Management and Consultants files a notice of data breach after discovering that the vulnerability in the MOVEit file transfer system allowed an unauthorized party to access consumer information.

Author: MoustachedBouncer
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a cyberespionage group named 'MoustachedBouncer', observed using adversary-in-the-middle (AitM) attacks at ISPs to hack foreign embassies in Belarus.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Knight
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover a campaign distributing the Knight ransomware in disguise of TripAdvisor complaints.

Author: Charming Kitten
Target: Iranian opposition and exiles based in Germany
Description: Germany’s domestic intelligence service (Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution - BfV) publishes a warning that Iranian dissident organizations and individuals in the country are being targeted by Charming Kitten, a suspected Iranian state-sponsored threat group.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The California city of El Cerrito investigates the potential theft of data after the LockBit ransomware group adds the city’s government to its list of victims.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Date Occurred: In the third and fourth week of March 2023
Target: Undisclosed Power Generator in South Africa
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky uncover a suspected cyberattack targeting a power generator in southern Africa with Cobalt Strike beacons and DroxiDat, a new variant of the SystemBC payload.

Author: APT29 (AKA Cozy Bear, Cloaked Ursa, BlueBravo, Midnight Blizzard, The Dukes, UNC2452 and formerly Nobelium)
Description: Researchers from EclecticIQ discover a recent campaign targeting the foreign ministries of NATO-aligned governments with two malicious PDF files camouflaged as diplomatic invitations from a German embassy.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: 8base
Description: Canadian dental benefits administrator Alberta Dental Service Corporation (ADSC) starts informing roughly 1.47 million individuals that their personal information was compromised in a 8base ransomware attack.

Author: AdLoad
Description: Researchers from AT&T discover a new campaign infecting thousands of Mac systems with the AdLoad malware to act as proxy exit nodes.

Target: FinTech users in the LATAM region
Description: Researchers from Zscaler reveal the details of JanelaRAT, a malicious tool used in a campaign targeting FinTech users in the LATAM region.

Target: Coastal Orthopedics & Sports Medicine of Southwest Florida
Description: Coastal Orthopedics & Sports Medicine of Southwest Florida posts a “Notice of Privacy Event” on its website after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to gain access to the company’s computer network.
The city of New Haven suffers a $6 million theft in a cyber attack after the Board of Education’s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Operating Officer fall victims of a “business email compromise.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: Colorado Department of Health Care Policy & Financing (HCPF)
Description: The Colorado Department of Health Care Policy & Financing (HCPF) alerts more than four million individuals of a data breach that impacted their personal and health information, after IBM suffered a MOVEit data theft attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Fidelity National Information Services (FIS Global) files a notice of data breach after discovering that a vulnerability in the MOVEit file transfer program used by FIS Global compromised consumer information

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Florida Healthy Kids join the list of the companies affected by the MOVEit breach after the breach suffered by Maximus, who issued the notification.
The FBI warns of an increase in scammers pretending to be recovery companies that can help victims of cryptocurrency investment scams recover lost assets.

Author: “Groups and individuals” linked to Chinese intelligence
Target: New Zealand’s diverse ethnic Chinese communities
Description: The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) accuses China of “ongoing activity in and against New Zealand.”

Author: Akira
Description: Belt Railway Company of Chicago, the largest switching and terminal railroad in the U.S. investigates the theft of data after the Akira ransomware group adds the company to its leak site.

Author: ThreatSec
Description: The ThreatSec group takes responsibility for infiltrating a data center under the jurisdiction of the Indonesian government.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Fredens of Security
Target: India Ministry of Food Processing Industries
Description: A threat actor dubbed Fredens of Security takes credit for exposing  4.5GB, purportedly containing 3 million records linked to India’s Ministry of Food Processing.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Fredens of Security
Target: India Ministry of Health & Family Welfare
Description: A threat actor dubbed Fredens of Security takes credit for exposing  4.5GB, purportedly containing 3 million records linked to India's Ministry of Health & Family Welfare
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: PieWithNothing
Description: A user on a hacker forum is allegedly selling data attributed to Shemaroo Entertainment. The attacker claims that this compromised dataset contains 16.4 million user entries, exposing sensitive details such as email addresses, passwords, phone numbers, and additional personal information.
Researchers from Cyble discover a campaign distributing the LummaC Stealer via the Amadey Bot to deploy the SectopRAT.
The Better Business Bureau warns again consumers of scammers exploiting the popularity of QR codes to defraud users across the US.
Cummins Behavioral Health Systems files a notice of data breach after confirming the company was the recent victim of a ransomware attack.
Hub International Limited files a notice of data breach after discovering that files on the company’s IT network were accessed and copied by an unauthorized party.

Researcher from Trustwave discover a campaign carried out via the search engine optimization (SEO) water hole technique called Gootloader targeting legal-related search terms and has been identified as a threat to law firms and people doing searches for legal information online.
Country: DE ES KR FR PT US

Description: Puntozero, the company that provides the IT services to the Italian region of Umbria, is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: Threat actors from North Korea
Description: Researchers from Phylum discover a new wave of malicious npm packages part of an ongoing campaign allegedly launched by North Korean threat actors.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers at San Diego State University identify 95,111 scam lists and 87,617 accounts linked to scams between June 2022 and June 2023.
Rapattoni, a real estate property listings in US, confirms to have been hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: Monti
Target: Organizations within the legal and government sectors
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Monti ransomware gang has returned, after a two-month break from publishing victims on their data leak site, using a new Linux locker to target VMware ESXi servers, legal, and government organizations.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Hudson Rock discover 120,000 infected systems containing credentials for cybercrime forums, many of the computers belonging to hackers.

Author: Akihirah
Description: The Discord.io custom invite service temporarily shuts down after suffering a data breach exposing the information of 760,000 members.
The FBI is warns of a new tactic used by cybercriminals where they promote malicious "beta" versions of cryptocurrency investment apps on popular mobile app stores that are then used to steal crypto.
Prince George's County Public Schools, one of the largest school districts in the United States, announces that it discovered a cyberattack on its network.
Cleaning product giant Clorox announces a cybersecurity incident that forced it to take several systems offline.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The German Federal Bar Association (BRAK) suffers a NoEscape ransomware attack.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The pro-Russia NoName057(16) collective takes down three Polish websites: PKP Polskie Linie Kolejowe, the custodians of Poland’s railway infrastructure, Plus Bank, a financial institution, and the Warsaw Metro.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Rhysida ransomware group adds Programa de Atencion Medica Integral (PAMI), an Argentinian public health insurance agency to its victim list.

Author: EUTNAIOA
Target: Multiple organizations in Japan including the Ministry of the Environment, The Japan Atomic Power Company, Atomic Energy Society of Japan (AESJ), Nuclear Regulation Authority, Japan Atomic Energy Commission (AEC), Japan Energy Association Wec, and many others.
Description: Hacktivists part of Anonymous (EUTNAIOA) claim to have attacked a large number of websites after the Japanese announcement of the planned release of treated Fukushima wastewater into the ocean.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: New York Life Insurance Company (NYLIC), one of the world’s largest corporations, admits to have been exposed to the MOVEit Transfer attacks via third-party vendor Pension Benefit Information (PBI).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Uptycs discover a new malicious tool dubbed QwixxRAT (AKA Telegram RAT).

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Alogent Holdings files a notice of data breach related to an incident occurred exploiting the vulnerability in MOVEit, resulting in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information, which includes their names, account and routing numbers, addresses, phone numbers, check payees and remittance amounts.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: VNS Health files a notice of data breach after discovering that TMG Health, a third-party vendor of VNS, experienced a data breach affecting information that VNS provided to the vendor.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois file a notice describing a third-party data breach that occurred at HCSC Insurance Services Company. The incident resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information, which includes their names, addresses, email addresses, phone numbers, dates of birth, Social Security Numbers, claim numbers, bank account numbers and medical service information.

M&T Bank files a notice of data breach explaining that an incident resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information, including their names and financial account information.
El Centro Del Barrio d/b/a CentroMed files a notice of data breach after discovering that unauthorized actors were able to access the company’s IT network.
in Surgut, a Siberian oil town, someone hacks an electronic sign, posting insults against President Putin.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang blackmails Levare International with a DDoS attack after hitting them with a ransomware.
Prince George’s County Public Schools (PGCPS) discloses to have suffered a cyber attack.
Researchers from Distrust say that a total of at least $900,000 was stolen across multiple blockchains exploiting the CVE-2023-39910 vulnerability dubbed Milk Sad.

Attackers exploit a price manipulation vulnerability on decentralized finance platform Zunami Protocol to steal more than $2.1 million and launder it via the U.S. government-sanctioned crypto mixer Tornado Cash.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Netskope discover multiple phishing campaings making use of Cloudflare R2 to host phishing pages.

Author: Raccoon Stealer
Description: Researchers from Cyberint reveal that the developers of Raccoon Stealer information-stealing malware have ended their 6-month hiatus from hacker forums to promote a new 2.3.0 version of the malware to cyber criminals.

Researchers from Fox-IT reveal that a threat actor has compromised close to 2,000 Citrix NetScaler servers in a massive campaign exploiting the critical-severity remote code execution tracked as CVE-2023-3519.
Researchers from Cyberint reveal that LinkedIn is being targeted in a wave of account hacks resulting in many accounts being locked out for security reasons or ultimately hijacked by attackers.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Banco Popular de Puerto Rico, Puerto Rico’s largest bank, joins the victim list of the MOVEit attacks after the personal data of its 82,217 clients were exposed via third-party vendor PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC).

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Medicine Camden Clark Medical Center joins the list of the MOVEit vulnerabilities victims.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: First Farmers Bank & Trust files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential FFBT customer information through the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: University of Massachusetts Chan Medical School (UMass Chan)
Description: University of Massachusetts Chan Medical School (UMass Chan) posts a website notice describing a data breach impacting 134,000 users and resulting from the organization's use of MOVEit.

Target: Advance America Cash Advance Centers of Montana and Advance America Cash Advance Centers of Vermont (Advance America)
Description: Advance America Cash Advance Centers of Montana and Advance America Cash Advance Centers of Vermont (Advance America) file notices of data breach explaining that a cyber incident resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information.
Cleveland City Schools say they are dealing with the aftermath of a ransomware attack.
Decentralized exchange RocketSwap loses $870,000 in a hack due to multiple vulnerabilities, including storing user private keys on its cloud servers via a brute-force attack.
Federal and local law enforcement agencies investigate into an alleged phishing scam perpetrated against Johnstown Regional Sewage.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack against Postel, a company controlled by the Italian National Mail.

Author: KmsdBot
Description: Researchers from Akamai discover an updated version of a botnet malware called KmsdBot,  targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices.
